intro: Galium miyabei, commonly known as Japanese bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white or pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Galium miyabei is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its foliage and flowers are sometimes used in traditional herbal remedies.
